channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why most New Year’s resolutions fail—and what that says about leadership habits
item.description: Yes, it’s that time of year again: when we don’t just wrap up one chapter but start anticipating the next, determined to begin with something that res...

item.title: The Fast Company AI 20 for 2025
item.description: The biggest story in tech is AI ’s increasing capacity to take on tasks once reserved for human beings. But the agents driving that change aren’t mach...

item.title: CEOs are making the business case for AI—and dispelling talk of a bubble
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: How Tech Employees Became Disposable
item.description: ‘Employees’ are now ‘workers,’ but that didn’t happen overnight.

item.title: 5 Tax Breaks for 2025 You Don’t Want to Miss Out On
item.description: Taking advantage of these changes could lower your upcoming tax bill.

item.title: You don’t need to have fun at work—take it from NBA head coach Joe Mazzulla: ‘Fun is a cop-out sometimes when things aren’t going well’
item.description: The famously intense Mazzulla was fielding a question about "fun" from a child reporter: "I struggle with that, to be honest with you."

item.title: Hershey’s innovation lab just created its own Dubai chocolate bar
item.description: Hershey’s has finally jumped on the Dubai chocolate trend , and it typifies the intentional approach the company is taking to viral candy. The Hershey...

item.title: I Interviewed a Neuroscientist 5 Years Ago. His New Warning About AI Should Terrify Every Leader
item.description: The central concern is about insight—those “aha” moments when you see a problem differently.

item.title: A Neuroscientist’s 5-Step Plan to Upgrade Your Brain
item.description: Neuroscience shows ‘metacognition’ makes you more likely to be successful. Here’s how strengthen this often overlooked skill.

item.title: Why a Weak Job Market Pushes Stock Prices Higher
item.description: Payrolls data came in weaker than expected, which raised bets for a Fed rate cut.

item.title: How Anthropic grew—and what the $183 billion giant faces next
item.description: In our latest Fortune cover story, AI editor Jeremy Kahn explores what's driving Anthropic's growth.

item.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp defends being an ‘arrogant prick’—and says more CEOs should be, too
item.description: Karp argues extreme confidence—checked by a “painfully flat” internal culture—is the only way to resist the "bailout culture" of modern corporate Amer...

item.title: Two months into the new fiscal year and the U.S. government is already spending more than $10 billion a week servicing national debt
item.description: Tariffs will bring in $300 billion to $400 billion a year, which would help to pay a fraction of the interest payments of more than $1 trillion in 202...

item.title: Why dynamic pricing is becoming the rule, not the exception
item.description: Changing prices for what the market will bear has long been a staple of pricing for everything from airplane seats to a gallon of gas to hotel rooms. ...

item.title: Visa’s next World Cup move: Soccer-themed art
